intro: Hydrangea hydrangeoides var. taquetii, commonly known as the Taquet’s hydrangea, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It features showy, cone-shaped flower clusters that range in color from white to pink, depending on soil pH. The plant has dark green, ovate leaves that turn yellow in autumn. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to change flower color, adding visual interest throughout the growing season.
